neurodivergent_people.title: Neurodivergent people
neurodivergent_people.description: The term neurodivergence describes all people who deviate from the neurotypical grid due to neurological or psychological reasons. This includes, for example, autistic people, people with dyslexia and people with ADHD.

people_of_color.title: People of Color
people_of_color.description: Political self-designation among all non-white people of African, Asian, Latin American, Arab, Jewish, indigenous or Pacific family origin.

help.headline: Help section
help.subline: Here you will find answers to questions about using our community platform.
help.subline2: Can't find an answer to your question? Please send us an email:

whatIsStem.question: What is STEM?
whatIsStem.answer: STEM stands for science, technology, engineering, mathematics. These fields form the foundation for numerous technological innovations and scientific discoveries. The term “STEM” includes the integration of various disciplines such as Art, Design, Music, the Environment, as well as societal or social issues. For example, if an artistic field is included, STEM is extended to STEAM, where the “A” stands for “Art”.

whoIsThePlatformFor.question: Who is our community platform for?
whoIsThePlatformFor.answer:
Our platform is aimed at stakeholders in STEM education, including:

  • Providers of STEM education programs
  • Employees of extracurricular STEM learning locations
  • Coordinators of regional STEM networks, STEM clusters or STEM projects
  • Advocates for women in STEM professions
  • Volunteers in the STEM field
  • Employees from business and industry who focus on STEM, girls and gender
  • Project developers and funders seeking STEM education providers, role models and projects
  • Anyone interested in STEM

benefitsOfThePlatform.question: What added value does the MINTvernetzt community platform offer?
benefitsOfThePlatform.answer:
The nationwide STEM community thrives on exchanging ideas, sharing knowledge and learning from one another. On the community platform, you can connect with others and organizations to find inspiration or experts on specific topics in your area. A wide range of functions and opportunities await you on the platform:

  • The STEM world in one place: Find stakeholders, initiatives, projects and events.
  • Make STEM projects visible: Showcase your projects and learn from others.
  • Register for upcoming events or browse through events you have already attended: Find other interested parties among participants and download presentations.
  • Utilize advanced filter and search functions: Search specifically for skills, target groups, regions or topics.
  • Quick answers: Browse the FAQ page with commonly asked questions and answers about the community platform.
  • Contribute ideas: Propose new functions or ideas to enhance the platform.

Upcoming functions:

  • Your events for the STEM community: Share your events with STEM stakeholders.
  • Strengthen your social presence: Use our graphic design beginner's tool and the STEM-related media database in the future.
  • Discover funding opportunities: Soon, try our fundraising crawler, which searches selected existing funding databases and displays suitable STEM funding on our platform.
  • Targeted networking: Benefit from a future matching system that suggests suitable people, projects or initiatives based on interests.

isItFree.question: Is the platform free to use?
isItFree.answer: Yes, the platform is available free of charge.

whoOperatesThePlatform.question: Who operates the platform?
whoOperatesThePlatform.answer:
The MINT-Vernetzungsstelle Deutschlands, or MINTvernetzt, is the central service and contact point for (extracurricular) STEM stakeholders in German-speaking countries. We create networking spaces and offer various free, practice-oriented workshop formats, including on how to address specific target groups in a targeted and non-stereotypical manner, innovative design and the financing and sustainanability of STEM offerings.

MINTvernetzt is funded by the Federal Ministry of Education and Research and is jointly implemented by employees of Körber Foundation, matrix gGmbH, Nationales MINT Forum e. V., Stifterverband and University of Regensburg.

matrix gGmbH is responsible developing and implementing the community platform. The MINTvernetzt community platform has been live since fall 2022. Our co-creative approach with participatory processes allows us to continuously develop the platform based on the needs and wishes of the STEM community. We are constantly expanding the platform. You can check the planned features on the platform's homepage under “Roadmap”.

registration.headline: Questions about registration and my profile

benefitsOfRegistration.question: Why should I register? I can already see content.
benefitsOfRegistration.answer: We aim to make many functions freely accessible so that you can view content easily. However, not all content is visible when you are not logged in, so we recommend registering. Additionally, profiles, organizations and projects can only be created after registration. You can also only register for events once you have created a profile. Other STEM stakeholders will only be able to find you if you can be found via your profile.

mintId.question: What is the MINT-ID?
mintId.answer:
With the MINT-ID, you can register for the MINTvernetzt community platform and the MINT-Campus at the same time. You only need to register once to access all features and offers of both platforms. The MINT Campus is the digital learning platform for the MINT community with freely accessible materials and learning opportunities for educational and project work.

The MINT-ID saves you time during registration and allows you to switch easily between the two platforms. You can continue using your MINTvernetzt account without a MINT-ID.

You can find more information about the MINT-ID here: https://mintcampus.org/mint-id/

registrationProblems.question: I have problems with registering or logging in. Who can I contact?
registrationProblems.answer: Please send a message to our technical support: support@mint-vernetzt.de

addToOrganization.question: How can I add myself as a team member to my organization?
addToOrganization.answer: The administrator of your organization can add you. We are currently working on a feature that will allow you to add yourself to an organization.

removeFromOrganization.question: I am no longer active in the organization/as an actor.
removeFromOrganization.answer: If you leave your organization, inform the administrator to remove your organization from the organization. In the future, this will be possible independently. If you remain within the MINT community, your new organization will be happy to add you as a team member. If you leave the MINT Community, you can also delete your profile. Click on “Settings” at the bottom left, where you can “Edit your profile” and find the “Delete profile” tab.

emailChanged.question: The e-mail address I am registered with no longer exists, e.g. because I have changed employer. How can I access my profile again?
emailChanged.answer: In this case, please contact our support team at support@mint-vernetzt.de

contentCreation.headline: Questions about creating organizations, projects and events

networkVsOrganization.question: What is the difference between a network and a member organization?
networkVsOrganization.answer: A network consists of several member organizations that work together to achieve common goals. Member organizations are the individual institutions that participate in these networks.

eventParticipation.question: I would like to take part in an event. How can I register?
eventParticipation.answer: Click on the “Events” tab in the navigation on the left and select the desired event. Then click on “Participate”. Please note that you must be registered on the platform to register for an event. Don't have a profile on the MINTvernetzt community platform yet? You can register here.

eventCreation.question: I would like to create an event. What do I have to consider?
eventCreation.answer:
Currently, we only provide MINTvernetzt and MINT-Campus events on the community platform. In the future, you will be able to share and create your own events.

Important: Our platform is NOT intended for children and young people, but exclusively at STEM stakeholders, education providers, network coordinators, etc. Events such as STEM vacation courses or weekly offers in a school lab are not included here.

contribution.question: I would like to get involved in the further development of the MINTvernetzt community platform.
contribution.answer: Are you a STEM actor, designer or programmer and are interested in actively shaping the platform? We are always looking for testers for new features. Contact us at community@mint-vernetzt.de. We develop the platform using open source software - click here for our GitHub repository.

questionsSuggestionsWishes.question: I have questions, suggestions or requests.
questionsSuggestionsWishes.answer: We welcome feedback and questions as we aim to develop the platform to best meet our users' needs. Feel free to contact Inga Leffers at community@mint-vernetzt.de.

futureDevelopment.question: What else is being developed?
futureDevelopment.answer: We present our current roadmap on the platform's homepage – even when not logged in. There you can find an overwiew of the functions we are currently developing and those planned for the future. For instance, we are working on a graphic design beginners' tool, a STEM-related media database and a funding crawler that searches selected existing funding databases and displays suitable STEM funding on our platform. We will keep you updated on new features via platform updates.

firstCard.title: Networking feature
firstCard.description: The networking feature allows you to connect with other professionals or organizations and categorize your contacts into lists.

secondCard.title: Matching feature
secondCard.description: An algorithm suggests suitable projects, organizations, and professionals for you..

thirdCard.title: Create your own events
thirdCard.description: As a STEM actor, you can create your own events and manage the participants.

fourthCard.title: Interaction
fourthCard.description: You can react to existing content such as projects or posts via interactions (such as liking or commenting).

fifthCard.title: MINT-Campus connection
fifthCard.description: See who is creating courses, which courses are being taken by others and show which courses you have completed.

firstCard.title: Visualize Networks
firstCard.description: We aim at showing the diverse connections and networks within our community. You can present your own network and discover other network structures, such as STEM clusters, STEM regions, fablabs etc.

secondCard.title: STEM sharepic and image database
secondCard.description: The Sharepic Generator helps you quickly and easily create graphics for e.g. your social media posts. You can find STEM images in the image database.

thirdCard.title: Funding tool
thirdCard.description: A web crawler gathers STEM funding opportunities and presents them to you on the platform.

firstCard.title: Add yourself to organizations
firstCard.description: You can add yourself to an organization and no longer have to have a team member add you.

secondCard.title: FAQ
secondCard.description: In this FAQ list, we collect frequently asked questions and answers about the community platform which provide you with further information about using the platform.

thirdCard.title: Dashboard
thirdCard.description: The dashboard provides an overview of all platform functions at a glance and keeps you informed about the latest news after logging in.

fourthCard.title: Filter function
fourthCard.description: With the filter, you can search profiles, organizations, events, or projects based on specific criteria.

fifthCard.title: Projects
fifthCard.description: All community members can share their experiences from insightful and successful projects, providing valuable information for learning and inspiration. This includes downloadable materials, details on project setups, and funding information.

sixthCard.title: Language setting: English
sixthCard.description: With the extended language setting, we enable a broader group of professionals to effectively use the community platform.

seventhCard.title: Eventmanagement
seventhCard.description: Browse for suitable MINTvernetzt events, register and see who has also registered for the event.

eighthCard.title: Profile & organization profile
eighthCard.description: You introduce yourself to the STEM community using your profile and by creating your organization with its team members.

ninthCard.title: Search
ninthCard.description: You can use the search function to search for profiles, organizations, events, projects and keywords.

tenthCard.title: MINT-ID
tenthCard.description: In order to be able to easily switch between the two offers MINTvernetzt and MINT-Campus, there is the MINT-ID, with which you can use both platforms (single sign-in).

networkInfo.sublineOne: Are you a coordinator or team member of a STEM cluster, a STEM region or another network?
networkInfo.sublineTwo: Read the following steps to create your organization as a <0>network organization</0>.

steps.headline: Set up your network correctly in 3 steps:

checkExisting.headline: Check if your network organization has already been created. If so, add yourself as a team member.
checkExisting.description: To do this, go to <0>“Add me to an organization”</0>. Here you can search for your organization or network on the platform <0>and add yourself.</0> If your network organization has not yet been created, you can do this in the following step.

createNetwork.headline: Create your network as an organization.
createNetwork.descriptionOne: Create your network using the <0>“Create organization”</0> button. In the next step, you can select the <0>organization type “Network”</0> and other applicable organization types.
createNetwork.descriptionTwo: Your network is now set up so that other organizations can request to join you or you can invite other organizations as network members.

addInformation.headline: Now you can further fill your network organization with information.
addInformation.description: Click on the <0>“Edit”</0> button and fill in the form with relevant information so that the community is well informed about your network.

invites.headline: Invites
invites.subline: An admin will be notified as soon as you respond to the invitation.

addOrganization.headline: Add me to an organization
addOrganization.subline: Search for organizations, add yourself as a team member or create an organization.

toasts.organizationsFound: Organizations with this name already exist. Ask if you can join an organization.

errors.alreadyInRelation: You have still requested to add this profile to this organization, have an invite or are already a member.
errors.custom: The data could not be saved. Please try again or contact the support team.

requests.rejectRequest: You have declined the membership request of {{academicTitle}} {{firstName}} {{lastName}}.

quit.success: You have successfully left the organization {{organization}}.
quit.lastAdmin: You cannot leave the organization because you are the last admin. Press edit to appoint another admin or delete the organization.

alerts.rejected: You have declined to join the {{organization}} organization.

general.headline: General
general.intro: What information would you like to share about yourself with the community? Use the eye icon to choose whether the information is publicly visible to everyone or only shared with registered users.

aboutMe.headline: About me
aboutMe.intro: Tell the community about yourself: Who are you and what do you specifically do in the STEM field? In which regions are you primarily active? What competencies do you bring and which topics are you particularly interested in within the STEM context?

description.label: Short description
description.placeholder: Describe yourself and your field of activity in more detail.

activityAreas.label: Activity areas
activityAreas.placeholder: Add regions where you are active.

offer.headline: I offer

website.headline: Website
website.intro: Where can the community learn more about you and your offerings?

socialMedia.headline: Social networks
socialMedia.intro: Where can the community get in touch with you?

network.headline: Add organization or network
network.intro:
The organization or network you are active in does not have a profile yet? Add it directly so that other members can learn about it as well.

If the organization already exists, contact the person who created it.

In the future, you will be able to add yourself to organizations independently.

content.headline: Registration confirmation
content.intro: Welcome to the STEM community! Please confirm the email address to activate your profile on the MINTvernetzt platform within 24 hours using the following link:

content.question: Already a member?
content.success: The profile for {{email}} has been created. To complete the registration, please confirm the registration link in your emails within 24 hours, which we have sent you from noreply@mint-vernetzt.de. Please also check your spam folder. If you have already registered with this email address before and have forgotten your password, you can reset your password here:

form.intro: Here you can create your personal profile. The organizations, networks, or companies in which you are active can be added in the next step.
